title: Virgin raises bar in business class war
text:
What are these? Moving up. A Virgin Australia Airbus A330 aircraft containing the new business class suite in Sydney on Monday, Aug. 17, 2015. Pic: AAP Image/Paul Miller Source: AAP 
JUST when it seemed airline wars had peaked, Virgin Australia has upped the ante on Qantas in an area certain to appeal to business travellers. 
To coincide with the launch of a new business class suite for its A330 fleet, Virgin Australia has teamed up with Nespresso to deliver the “finest quality of coffee in the sky”. 
The newly refitted Business Class cabin will feature the first Nespresso by B/E Aerospace machines in the world, designed to overcome the challenges of making coffee at altitude. All smiles. John Borghetti CEO from Virgin Australia unveiling new standard in domestic business class flying. Picture: Adam Taylor/News Corp Australia Source: News Corp Australia 
Virgin Australia Chief Customer Officer Mark Hassell said the partnership would set new standards in domestic business travel. 
“Guests on Virgin Australia’s new Airbus A330 business class will be the first in the world to experience this new technology aimed at creating the finest coffee at 30,000 feet,” said Mr Hassell. 
“Our Airbus A330 business class dining service is designed to ensure our guests arrive at their destination feeling refreshed and recharged, and coffee plays an important part in that.” 
Virgin Australia CEO John Borghetti said the combination of the new suite, and the collaboration with Nespresso would change the game in domestic business class travel. 
“In 2011 we brought choice and competition to Business Class in Australia for the first time in a decade,” said Mr Borghetti. The new Virgin Australia Airbus A330 business class suite in Sydney on Monday, Aug. 17, 2015. (AAP Image/Paul Miller) NO ARCHIVING Source: AAP 
“We believe this new product will ensure that Virgin Australia is the number one choice for premium travellers on the all important transcontinental routes. 
“Later is year Virgin Australia will change the game again and it’s the launch of its new long haul Business Class on our Boeing 777 flights to Los Angeles and Dubai.” 
Australian Business Traveller editor David Flynn said the move was another indication of “Qantas and Virgin Australia going literally flat out to win over business travellers and corporate high flyers on the lucrative east-west route”. 
“It’s the sort of dogfight which we haven’t seen since the days of Ansett Australia, and that sort of intense competition is a good thing for the consumer. Designer suite. The new Virgin Australia Airbus A330 business class suite in Sydney, Pic: AAP Image/Paul Miller Source: AAP 
“So in the end, the winner isn’t a matter of Qantas or Virgin Australia as much as it is the business traveller.” 
The new business class suite was first unveiled in Singapore last September, and described as the longest, widest fully lie flat bed in domestic service. 
It will be part of a reconfigured cabin layout to give every business class passenger direct aisle access. 
The suite will even be slightly reclined so passengers never sit completely upright.
